intro: Catabrosa scabra, commonly known as the rough catabrosa, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its hairy, succulent leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Catabrosa scabra is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
